title: TST test_ria_basics.py:test_binary_data run failed on bionic

labels.name: RIA/ORA
labels.description: Issues related to RIA-based workflows and related components

body:
Not sure if a fluke or reproducible but should be addressed one way or another.

Ran into while running timing of tests on bionic for #4766 : [full log](https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/711507070/log.txt) 

```
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad.distributed.tests.test_ria_basics.test_binary_data('datalad-test',)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 268, in newfunc
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 728, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 728, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/distributed/tests/test_ria_basics.py", line 465, in _test_binary_data
    ds.download_url(url, path=file, message="Add DICOM file from github")
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/distribution/dataset.py", line 503, in apply_func
    return f(**kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 494, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 482, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.7/lib/python3.5/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 469, in generator_func
    msg="Command did not complete successfully")
datalad.support.exceptions.IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully. 1 failed:
[{'action': 'download_url',
  'message': "'QuietConsoleLog' object has no attribute 'yesno' "
             '[__init__.py:__getattribute__:101]',
  'path': '/tmp/datalad_temp__test_binary_datafthxi_uu/dicomfile',
  'status': 'error',
  'type': 'file'}]
```
so it looks like it is trying to communicate something the the "user".
